6 Objects

The CSS Objects are classes which provides a functionality but cannot be considered components themselves because have not a specific UI. For example, the media object applies a specific alignment or the box-shadow object provides a way to share the same box-shadow across the whole app.

These objects could be used as independent pieces of code, combined with components and/or other items of the framework or ignored. Much of them are used internally by the components to re-use code and provide a coherent experience across the UI.

6.1 Media

The Media Object is the Egeo implementation of the Nicolle Sullivan's media object.

To find out how to use and what exactly is, read Nicoleâ€™s blog post.

Usage

<div class="egeo-o-media">
     <a href="#" class="egeo-o-media__img">
         <img src="public/assets/images/header.logo.png" alt="logo" />
     </a>

     <div class="egeo-o-media__bd">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur
                                   adipiscing elit. Sed sed ipsum elit.
                                   Curabitur sed varius nibh. Proin quis sem elementum,
                                   fringilla diam quis, aliquet ipsum. Vestibulum
                                   convallis nisi sed est volutpat ullamcorper.
                                   Suspendisse bibendum urna nec facilisis consequat.
                                   Phasellus imperdiet malesuada quam et semper.
                                   Praesent fermentum, quam in interdum rutrum,
                                   velit enim molestie tortor, at consequat dolor
                                   lorem id lectus. Nullam egestas convallis est
                                   at pretium. Vivamus accumsan lorem at enim
                                   egestas porta. Vivamus eleifend enim vel arcu
                                   pretium suscipit. Donec interdum lectus vel
                                   arcu rutrum tincidunt. Praesent interdum enim arcu,
                                   sed placerat diam vulputate non.
     </div>
</div>

<div class="egeo-o-media">
     <a href="#" class="egeo-o-media__img--right">
         <img src="public/assets/images/header.logo.png" alt="logo" />
     </a>

     <div class="egeo-o-media__bd">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur
                                   adipiscing elit. Sed sed ipsum elit.
                                   Curabitur sed varius nibh. Proin quis sem elementum,

     </div>
</div>

Will product the next result:

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-o-media
true
Whether or not we want to include the media object in the compiled CSS.
$egeo-o-media---margin
10px
The margin value the media object will use to separate the items which belong to it.
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

6.2 Box Shadow

The Box Shadow object includes a series of variables and a mixin to help all components in an application to have the same shadow using a common way to do it.

Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

egeo-o-box-shadow

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the box-shadow property as is defined by the variables exposed to theming (see below).

.egeo-o-box-shadow

@classtested

If the class is not silenced, the css will include the .egeo-o-box-shadow class with which we can apply the box-shadow effect everywhere we want.

Usage

Using the mixin

.test {
       @include egeo-o-box-shadow;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
     box-shadow: 0 0 3px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh2), 0 0 1px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh3), 0 3px 2px -1px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh1);
}

Using the class

<div>
     <div class="egeo-o-box-shadow" style="background: red; display: inline-block; height: 200px; width: 200px;"></div>
</div>

Will product the next result:

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value
$egeo-o-box-shadow
true
$egeo-shadows
A Sass map with RGBA colors to be used as shadows. The values are sh1, sh2 and sh3, with value rgba(0, 0, 0, .1), rgba(0, 0, 0, .15) and rgba(0, 0, 0, .3) respectively.
$egeo-o-box-shadow---box-shadow
0 0 3px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh2), 0 0 1px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh3), 0 3px 2px -1px map-get($egeo-shadows, sh1)
$egeo-o-box-shadow---shadow-color
map-get($egeo-shadows, sh3)
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
